page.title: 09EASTRIGGS THROUGH TRAFFIC
page.content: Average 300 vehicles per hour, each direction, day time, on A75 Gretna Sranraer trunk road; about half lorries and large vans, half cars and small vans. Many of the lorries are Irish. They use the Stranraer or Cairnryan ferry (shortest Ireland_Britain sea crossing) then follow A75 to England. Several accidents (some fatal) on our part of the A75. Houses, walls, railings, hedges, lamp posts demolished. In summmer much busier tourist traffic going to Galloway. Sometimes traffic jams, caused by Annan traffic lights, stretch from Annan (3 miles) back to Eastriggs. In 1986 or 1987, work begins on new road by_passing Eastriggs and Annan. Facilities for travellers, garage with petrol; restaurant; 2 pubs (meals); no toilets
